More…            Features   Students  Students may check out laptops and other multimedia equipment for three days at a time, at no cost, from two locations:   BSB Learning Center (first floor of BSB next to the cafeteria)  Windows laptops  Device charging cables/adapters    Academic Multimedia Lab (Daley Library IDEA Commons room 1-030)  Windows laptops for general use  Windows and Apple laptops dedicated to multimedia production/editing use  Device charging cables/adapters  Digital projectors  Camcorders  Tripods  SD Card    Digital audio recorders  USB headsets  and more!     Faculty: In-Class Use  Faculty/Instructors are able to check out equipment for use in a particular class session. Checkouts are made for the duration of a class session and must be returned promptly to be available for other instructors. Equipment can be checked out from the LTS Support office at Lecture Center E, room E112 (west side of the building). We currently have the following types of equipment available for reservation:   Display adapters to connect your device to the multimedia systems found in the classrooms  Wireless microphones for larger classrooms  Laptops for instructor use  Digital projectors  USB webcams/microphones  Various other equipment to meet your teaching needs!   High-value items such as laptops and projectors *must* be checked out in-person from the LTS Support Office. Instructors may designate a teaching assistant to pick up equipment in their stead.  Multiple-Day Use  Faculty/instructors are able to check out multimedia equipment for the purpose of multimedia development from the Academic Multimedia Lab, located in the Daley Library room 1-030. Checkouts are for three business days with an ability to renew the checkout. The following equipment is available at this location:   Windows or Apple laptops with multimedia software pre-installed  iPads  Digital projectors  Camcorders  Tripods  SD Cards    Digital audio recorders  USB headsets  and more!            More Info   In order to check out equipment from the ACCC, you must be a current student, faculty, or staff member. Laptops are limited to three total checkouts per semester, in order to ensure the limited supply of laptops is available to as many students as possible. All lending of equipment is subject to the Equipment Lending Policy .  All Users   Borrower shall not leave equipment unattended while checked out  Borrower may only check out one of each type of device at a time  Borrower may not redistribute equipment to any other person(s)  Borrower is solely responsible for the equipment checked out to them, until the equipment has been returned and checked back in. This includes but is not limited to:  damage/destruction  loss  theft due to negligence  late return  misuse of any kind    Borrower is solely responsible for any fines resulting from above mentioned occurrences  Borrower is required to submit a police report to the UIC Police immediately upon loss/theft of equipment and to provide the police report number to the ACCC within 24 hours  Borrower must abide by all university, state, and federal policies and laws regarding the appropriate use of the university network and computing resources  Failure to adhere to the conditions of use may result in the loss of equipment loan privileges  Having a suspended ACCC account will prevent login access to the laptops loaned by the ACCC  The ACCC reserves the right to deny an equipment loan request, based on UIC account suspension status, previous fines, intended use, or other factors   Student Users   Borrower must be physically present and provide their valid UIC i-card to checkout equipment  The maximum length of a loan is three business days from time of checkout  A checkout may, at ACCC’s discretion, be renewed one time for a total of six business days of checkout  The borrower must physically visit the original checkout location with the checked out equipment to request the renewal    There is a per-semester limit of three checkouts for laptops, to ensure that the limited supply of laptops is able to benefit the greatest number of students  Failure to return equipment by the due date and time will result in late return fines, in addition to a hold being placed on borrower’s account, preventing further equipment checkout until the equipment is returned and for a one week period afterwards  This penalty will be extended for any repeat offenses    Fines are charged to the borrower’s UIC student account, and failure to pay may impact borrower’s ability to obtain transcripts, register for classes, and/or graduate  The borrower will receive an email confirmation of the equipment checkout, detailing a checkout reference number, the equipment checked out, and return deadlines   Faculty/Staff Users   Borrower must be physically present and provide their valid UIC i-card to checkout equipment  The borrower will receive an email confirmation of the equipment checkout, detailing a checkout reference number, the equipment checked out, and return deadlines  There may be fees associated with obtaining equipment from the ACCC for non-course-related use  Fees vary based on the type of equipment needed, and the duration of the rental  These fees will be detailed and explained prior to equipment checkout    The above fees, as well as any fines, will be charged to borrower’s department CFOAP account                Support & Lending Locations
